definition:
Let $$\begin{aligned}
\dot{x}_1 &=& f_1(x_1,\ldots,x_n)\\
& \vdots & \\
\dot{x}_n &=& f_n(x_1,\ldots,x_n)\end{aligned}$$ be a system of first
order ordinary differential equation. The $x_j$ *nullcline* is the set
of points which satisfy $f_j(x_1,\ldots,x_n)=0$. Note that at an
intersection point of all the nullclines implies that $$\begin{aligned}
0 &=& f_1(x_1,\ldots,x_n)\\
& \vdots & \\
0 &=& f_n(x_1,\ldots,x_n).\end{aligned}$$ Hence the intersection point
of all the nullclines is an equilibrium point of the system.\
\
**example:**

-   see some qualitative analysis of FitzHugh-Nagumo equation using
    nullclines
